interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: It Might Get Loud Review Date: 2010/08/12 Store: Jimmy Page (Actor), The Edge (Actor), Davis Guggenheim (Director, Producer) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'A documentary on the electric guitar from the point of view of three significant rock musicians: The Edge, Jimmy Page, and Jack White. Starring: Jimmy Page, The Edge, Jack White', 'Amazon.com', 'Three generations of rock guitarists come together for', 'It Might Get Loud', ', a 2009 documentary directed by Davis Guggenheim (', 'An Inconvenient Truth', '). These are not just your garden-variety guitar gods: Jimmy Page, in his mid-\'60s at the time of the film, founded Led Zeppelin, who dominated the 1970s following the breakup of the Beatles. As a member of U2, 48-year-old David Evans, better known as the Edge, created one of the most distinctive and influential sounds of the past quarter century. And 34-year-old Jack White (of the White Stripes, the Raconteurs, and the Dead Weather) was described by one music publication as "the most significant rock \'n\' roll figure of the past ten years." Guggenheim, who followed the three around for the better part of a year, takes us into their individual lives, past and present. There are shots of Page as a young London session musician, with the Yardbirds and Zeppelin, at Headley Grange (the estate where much of the fourth Zep album was made), and at home with his record collection. The Edge takes us to the Dublin classroom where U2 first rehearsed, as well as to the practice room he uses now (never a virtuoso soloist, he developed a style based on texture and a mind-boggling array of effects); and White, whose insistence on authenticity is admirable but perhaps a tad self-conscious, constructs a "guitar" from a plank of wood, a piece of wire, and a Coke bottle (he also plays a recording by the primitive bluesman Son House, featuring just voice and handclaps, that White says is still his biggest inspiration). The three also converge on a Hollywood sound stage, where they chat and a do a little jamming on Zep\'s "In My Time of Dying" (with all three playing slide guitar) and the Band\'s "The Weight." It\'s hard to say if the film\'s appeal will extend beyond guitar freaks and fans of these particular bands, but at the very least,', 'It Might Get Loud', "offers some interesting insight into the soul and inspiration behind some of pop's best and most popular music.", '--Sam Graham'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Documentary, Musical', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Bono, Jimmy Page, Davis Guggenheim, The Edge, Jack White, Steel Curtain Pictures, LLC, Peter Afterman, Lesley Chilcott, The Edge, Thomas TullBono, Jimmy Page, Davis Guggenheim, The Edge, Jack White, Steel Curtain Pictures, LLC, Peter Afterman, Lesley Chilcott, The Edge, Thomas Tull See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 38 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.3 x 0.7 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '6524754', 'Director': 'Davis Guggenheim', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 38 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 22, 2009', 'Actors': 'Jimmy Page, The Edge, Jack White, Bono, The Edge', 'Producers': 'Thomas Tull, Davis Guggenheim, Lesley Chilcott, Peter Afterman', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I watched this because seeing Pagey in this kind of detail is rare.
One has to put up with Jack White (as white as they come, good name) and Dull Edge (incongruous seeing him on stage--or the same planet--with Jimmy Page) but overall is is worth it. I did have to go to "mute" on several occasions, when I could not stand it. Review Title: Seeing Pagey here is worth putting up with the other two Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

profile:
The user appears to have a strong appreciation for rock music, particularly as it relates to legendary musicians and their influence. Key interests include documentaries that delve into the lives and careers of iconic guitarists and their musical journeys. The user rates their experiences positively, suggesting they value insightful storytelling that offers a deep dive into the artistry behind music.

The user has a preference for classic rock and likely seeks content that features well-known figures from this genre. They demonstrate an openness to different perspectives within the rock scene, even if they may not personally favor all contributors; for example, they express mixed feelings about some musicians compared to others but still recognize the overall value of the experience.

Additionally, the emphasis on detailed portrayals, personal narratives, and authenticity reflects a trend towards valuing in-depth explorations of artistic processes. The user’s feedback suggests a nuanced understanding of both music and the documentary format, indicating they may gravitate towards content that merges entertainment with informative insights.
